children.subject:
it sounds doable but slightly heavy, cs188's workload isn't too light, you have 1 written hw per two~three weeks, 1 (very long)electronic hw every week, and 1 programming project every two weeks, the concepts itself isn't too straight forward as well. CS170 is difficult conceptually, and usually ppl spend 8+ hours on the pset. and...cs61c, the workload is a nightmare, worse than cs188 or cs170 alone. and you also have a breath...

but this is from the standpoint of an average cs student, it also depends on your past workloads

So if I don't / can't find a good enough study group, will I struggle taking 170 and 61c (Weaver) together (especially with a lot of work from both classes)?

do you think I'd fare better taking 170 with eecs 16b, even though Sahai's teaching it this semester and he's known to give a ton of hw?

I can't say for sure. A study group isn't at all necessary, it just helped me stay sane when we were remote. But since next semester is on campus the issue is in part alleviated.

Not sure about 16B, since I didn't take it with Sahai.

I did this same schedule my sophomore fall. As Calc said, doable but on the heavier side. Personally I found 188's workload quite light (apart from the week before the singular midterm when I'd be doing lots of practice exams). The homeworks and projects were all pretty fast for me, but YMMV depending on how easily you absorb lecture material and/or can understand the notes.

170 and 61C will be dominating your weekly work, moreso 61C (I usually did 170 psets over the weekend). I had the luxury of a good study group for both of these classes which helped a huge amount with the "tricks" in 170 hw and to deal with the sheer number of assignments in 61C. 61C is indeed a nightmare.

It really depends on your prior experience but the schedule is doable.
I don't know about you, but I doubt that most people were able to finish the 170 psets over a weekend
I get them done on Mondays usually, they don't take that long.

I also did this in the fall and the ranking in terms of workload goes like this:

61C > 170 > 188

61C is just a nightmare, but a necessity for the prereqs it satisfies for upper divs. 170 was just weekly chore with psets you can start and finish over a weekend, as well as trying to attend lecture/discussion to understand concepts. 188 felt nearly the same workload as 170, but just feels lighter because there is only one midterm and grading is on an absolute scale (no curve). You know what grade you will get in this class at the end. But yeah, everyone else is on point about their experience.

I'm doing that this sem except I'm in two breadths (that I'm PNPing to avoid spending time on them).

It's fine, 61c is a bit rough while 188 is very light and 170 is fairly light. 188 weekly homeworks don't take much time at all.

For reference, I did 61a, 70 no hw option, 47b, 16b, and a breadth last semester and that was much more chill, but the 16b labs that semester were dialed back versus the usual.

history.content:
Just out of curiosity, how feasible is the following workload:

CS 61C, CS 170, CS 188, breadth
history.subject: Feasible Workload
